ul.li: Differential - Adjustable user setting that changes the tank temperature differential with a range of 2° to 20°F. The factory setting is 8°F
Tank Temperature - Non adjustable. Control system sensed temperature (averaged from upper & lower temperature probes).
Tank Probe Offset - adjustable user setting, range -5° to +5° (factory setting 0°).

li.note: These settings should only be used if hot water supply temperature varies greatly from the Operating Set Point setting.
li.p: The Tank Probe Offset is used to calibrate control system temperature sensing. This can improve the precision of temperature control in the storage tank and at points of use. This feature can also be used to compensate for building recirculation loops (hot water returning to the storage tank) that can cause the heating cycles to terminate prematurely.

Example: If the current temperature from a temperature probe is 120°F (49°C) and the Offset setting is adjusted to a value other than 0°, the control system would calibrate or “offset” the sensed temperature from the probe and the averaged tank temperature. Heating cycles would be activated and deactivated based on the calibrated (offset) temperature. A -5° setting results in +5° hotter water.
